The Exchange had  sought clarification from the Company with respect to news item captioned- Workers at India Yamaha Motor, Eicher Motors and others on strike.. The response from the Company is attached.
Eicher Motors Limited has informed the Exchange regarding 'Intimation under Regulation 30 of SEBI LODR Regulations, 2015'.

The Exchange has sought clarification from the Company with respect to news item captioned- Workers at India Yamaha Motor, Eicher Motors and others on strike. In this regard, Exchange has advised the Company to provide clarification/confirmation on the news item in detail including the following: a) Whether such event/negotiations/article stated in published news were taking place? If so, you are advised to provide the said information along with the sequence of events in chronological order and the material impact of this article on the Company. b) Whether company is aware of any information that has not been announced to the Exchanges under regulation 30 of Listing Regulations. The response from the Company is awaited.

Eicher Motors Limited has informed the Exchange that Due to heavy rains and flooding in Chennai, both of Royal Enfield's production facilities in Thiruvottiyur and Oragadam were shut between the 1st and 6th of December 2015. Company resumed production of motorcycles on December 7, 2015 with Company manufacturing facilities operating at 50% of our installed capacity. Over the course of the last week Company production rates improved steadily as Company facilities, employees and suppliers recovered from the aftermath of the floods. As of Monday, the December 14, 2015, Company is back to normal at our plants, and are running at 100% of the companies installed capacity at Royal Enfield. Company continue to monitor the situation closely and work in the best interest of our employees, customers, business partners and the larger eco-system in Chennai.

Eicher Motors Limited has informed the Exchange vide letter dated December 07, 2015 that "Due to heavy rains and flooding in Chennai, both of Royal Enfield's production facilities in Thiruvottiyur and Oragadam were shut since the 1st of December 2015. We resumed production of motorcycles on December 7, 2015. However, due to a high rate of absenteeism by our employees, and issues with our local suppliers - we will be running at approximately 50% capacity this week, and plan to be back up to 100% capacity by next week. Prima facie, there is no damage to equipment or property and all our employees are safe and secure. We have had production loss of 7200 motorcycles due to the closure of both our manufacturing facilities between December 1- 6, 2015. Many parts of the supply chain still continue to be affected due to the aftermath of floods. Due to the rains, in November we lost production of 4000 motorcycles. We continue to monitor the situation closely and work in the best interest of all our stakeholders. We would be able to assess the insurance loss in due course, once the full normalcy is restored".

Eicher Motors Limited has informed the Exchange vide letter dated December 03, 2015 that "The unprecedented rainfall in Chennai has severely affected the city including our employees, our manufacturing facilities and offices. The floods caused by the rain have also impacted logistics and our supply-chain, resulting in disruption of our production. As a consequence, we have shut down our offices in the city and our plants in Thiruvottiyur and Oragadam since December 1st. Due to the rains, in November we lost production of 4000 motorcycles. We are working to ensurethat all our employees are safe. We are monitoring the situation closely and hoping for normalcy to return soon".

The Exchange had sought clarification from Eicher Motors Limited with respect to a news item captioned "Royal Enfield to invest Rs. 500 cr to expand biz". The Company has clarified that "Over the last many years, the demand for our products has been growing rapidly. In order to meet this market demand, we have been increasing our production capacity. Also, in order to ensure longer term growth, our focus is on developing new products, expanding distribution network and strengthening our organisational capabilities in sales/marketing, information technology, human resources etc. Also, we intend to build 2 technology centres   a larger centre in Chennai, India and a smaller satellite centre in UK. These will strengthen our capabilities in product development. The capex of Rs. 500 crores will be invested in all of these areas".

The response from the Company is awaited.

Eicher Motors Limited has informed the Exchange that the Company has entered into a Joint Venture Agreement (JVA) on July 23, 2012 with Polaris Industries Inc., U.S.A. (Polaris) relating to a strategic partnership and to start a green field project in the automotive sector. The salient features of the JVA are as under:(1) The Company and Polaris will equally hold shares in Joint Venture Company (JVC) i.e. 50-50 partnership. (2) Joint Venture Company will design, develop, manufacture and sell a full new range of personal vehicles suitable for India and other emerging markets. (3) The overall investment over a three year period will be approximately INR 250 crores.(4) The manufacturing facility will be located in India and the expected start of production will be in the year 2015. (5) Joint Venture Company will be managed by the Company and  Polaris with equal representation from both the companies. Further the Company has submitted a Copy of press release dated July 24, 2012 titled"Eicher Motors Limited and Polaris Industries Inc. sign Joint Venture agreement in the automotive sector".

The Company has now informed the Exchange that "Pursuant to the aforesaid Scheme, the Company has to issue and allot 1,40,32,764 fully paid-up equity shares of Rs.10/- each to the member of residual Eicher Goodearth Investment Limited (EGIL) in the proportion in which they hold equity shares in Residual EGIL., For this purpose, the Share Allotment Committee in their meeting held on 30th November, 2009 fixed the Record Date as December 9, 2009 for the purpose of issuance of equity shares to the shareholders of Residual EGIL. The 'Appointed Date' of the Scheme is January 01, 2009. The Company has now informed the Exchange that the Hon'ble High Court of Delhi vide its order dated October 27, 2009 has approved the aforesaid Scheme. As part of the Scheme, the Company shall issue and allot 1,40,32,762 fully paid-up equity shares of Rs. 10/- each to the members of residual Eicher Goodearth Investments Limited (EGIL) in the proportion in which they hold equity shares in Residual EGIL. Eicher Motors Ltd has informed the Exchange that "The Board of Directors of VE Commercial Vehicles Limited ('VECV'), a subsidiary company of Eicher Motors Ltd., ('EML') in its Board Meeting held on October 30, 2009 have decided to explore the further business opportunities in the field of Engineering Design Services along with Vinn Group AB of Sweden (a joint venture company between Vinn Group and Volvo Technology Transfer AB (VTT), a wholly owned subsidiary of AB Volvo) for aligning its Engineering Design Services Division alongwith EES Inc., USA and its two subsidiaries in China (collectively referred as 'EES Division') that currently contributes only around 2% of VECV consolidated revenues and around  1.7% of EML consolidated revenues. For this purpose, a non-binding Memorandum of Understanding ('MOU') is being signed amongst Vinn Group AB of Sweden, VECV and their respective shareholders. The objective of the MOU is to explore the alignment of  EES Division of VECV with Vinn Group AB, Sweden through an efficient structure. The Board of Directors of EML in their meeting held on October 31, 2009 after deliberations authorized Mr. Siddhartha Lal, Managing Director of the Company to take all necessary steps with respect to above".

JM Financial Consultants Private Limited has informed the Exchange regarding the Public Notice cum Public Announcement ("Announcement") made in compliance with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Buy-back of Securities) Regulations, 1998 as amended. The Offer and Buy-Back price : Eicher Motors Ltd (the "Company" or"EML") hereby announces the Buy-back of up to 14,08,969 fully paid-up equity shares of the face value Rs. 10 each ("Equity Shares") from the existing owners of Equity Shares (the "Buy-back") through the Tender Offer route in accordance with section 77A of the Companies Act, 1956 as amended to date (hereinafter referred to as "Act") and the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Buy Back of Securities) Regulations, 1998 as amended up to date (hereinafter referred to as "Buy-Back Regulations") at a price of Rs. 691.68 per Equity Share ("Buy Back Price") payable in cash, for an amount aggregating up to Rs. 97.46 crores ("Offer Size"). The Offer Size represents up to 21.28% of the aggregate of the Company's total paid-up equity capital and free reserves as on March 31, 2008. The buyback would not be more than 25% of its paid-up equity capital as provided under section 77A of the Companies Act, 1956. The Date of Opening of the Buyback : March 12, 2009. The date of closing of the Buyback : March 26, 2009. Last date of communicating rejection/acceptance and payment of consideration for accepted tenders and/or the unaccepted equity shares/share certificates will be dispatched/credited : April 08, 2009. A copy of the Public Announcement - Buyback of shares shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements). desc: Reg.7(3) of SEBI (Substantial Acq of shares &Takeovers),1997
attchmntText: Eicher Motors Ltd has informed the Exchange that Franklin Templeton Mutual Fund, through its scheme Franklin India Prima Fund (FIPF) has sold 5,02,090 shares aggregating to 1.79% of the total share capital of Eicher Motors Ltd. on September 27, 2005. The details of the shareholding of Franklin Templeton Mutual Fund under its various schemes after the said sale is as follows: (1) Franklin India Prima Fund (FIPF) - 6,97,958 shares (2.48%); (2) Franklin India Taxshield 96 (FIT96) - 48,206 shares (0.17%); (3) FT India Balanced Fund (FTIBF) - 40,796 shares (0.15%); (4) Templeton India Pension Plan (TIPP) - 23,896 shares (0.09%); (5) Franklin India Taxshield 97 (FIT97) - 16,364 shares (0.06%); (6) Aggregate shareholding of Franklin Templeton Mutual Fund under its various schemes is 8,27,220 shares aggregating to 2.94% of the total share capital of Eicher Motors Ltd.

desc: Disc under Reg Subs Acq &Takeover & SEBI Insider Trading Reg
attchmntText: Fidelity International has informed the Exchange that FMR Corp and its direct and indirect subsidiaries and Fidelity International Limited ("FIL") and its direct and indirect subsidiaries have acquired 500,000 shares aggregating to 1.78% of the total paid up capital of Eicher Motors Limited on September 27, 2005. The mode of acquisition is through Open Market and the shareholding of FMR Corp and its direct and indirect subsidiaries and Fidelity International Limited ("FIL") and its direct and indirect subsidiaries after the said acquisition is 1,507,049 shares aggregating to 5.36% of the total paid up capital of Eicher Motors Limited.

desc: Disc under SEBI(Subs Acqui. of shares &takeovers) Reg 1997
attchmntText: Eicher Motors Ltd has informed the Exchange that Franklin Templeton Mutual Fund-through its various schemes has sold 1, 00,000 shares aggregating to 0.36% of the total share capital of Eicher Motors Ltd. on September 09, 2005.The shareholding of Franklin Templeton Mutual Fund-through its various schemes after the said sale is 16,81,320 shares amounting to 5.98% of the total paid-up capital of Eicher Motors Ltd.

Eicher Motors Ltd has informed the Exchange that the auditor's have conducted the limited review of the unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2005 and the details of the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

Eicher Motors Ltd has informed the Exchange that the Company has acquired 100% of the shares of Design Intent Engineering Inc., USA ("DESIGN") for a total consideration of USD 2.5 million. DESIGN, a company incorporated and existing under the Laws of the State of Michigan, U.S.A. is engaged in the business of providing computer aided engineering and design services to tier I and II suppliers and OEMs. This acquisition will provide a strong platform for growth in the engineering services business that has tremendous potential and synergies with the Company's Commercial Vehicles Business.

Eicher Motors Ltd had informed the Exchange regarding the approval of the Board of Directors for sale of its tractors, engines and gears divisions at Mandideep, Alwar and Parwanoo, respectively, to TAFE Motors and Tractors Limited (TMTL), a wholly owned subsidiary of Tractors and Farm Equipment Limited, by way of a "Slump sale"  (as defined under Section 2 (42 C) of the Income Tax Act, 1961 ) on a 'going concern' basis.Subsequent to the approval of Board of Directors, the Company has entered into Business Purchase Agreement on May 27, 2005 with TMTL. The aforesaid transaction has also been approved by the shareholders with requisite majority through postal ballot on June 28, 2005. In this regard, the Company has now informed the Exchange that Closing under the Business Purchase Agreement dated May 27, 2005 has occurred on June 30, 2005 and TMTL has dicharged its obligation to pay the consideration payable on Closing in terms of the said Business Purchase Agreement.

Eicher Motors Ltd has informed the Exchange that the following resolutions have been approved by the shareholders with requisite majority through postal ballot: 1. Ordinary Resolution under Section 293(1)(a) of the Companies Act, 1956 for sale of the Company's Tractors division at Mandideep, Gears division at Parwanoo and Engine division at Alwar ("Tractors and allied divisions") on a slump sale basis to TAFE MOTORS AND TRACTORS LIMITED (TMTL). 2. Special Resolution under Section 17 and 18 of the Companies Act, 1956 for insersion of new Sub Clause 30 in the Other Objects (Clause III.C) of Memorandum of Association of the Company.

Eicher Motors Ltd has informed the Exchange that the BOD's in its meeting held on June 25, 2005, decided among other things the following: (1) The Register of Members of the Company will remain closed from August 09, 2005 to August 17, 2005 (both days inclusive); (2) The AGM has been fixed for August 17, 2005 for consideration of the routine items including declaration of dividend.
Eicher Motors Ltd has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors in their meeting held on June 25, 2005 has recommended 40% dividend on the equity capital, subject to approval of shareholders.

Eicher Motors Ltd has informed the Exchange that pursuant to Section 192A of the Companies Act, 1956 read with the Companies (Passing of the Resolutions by Postal Ballot) Rules, 2001, the following resolutions are proposed to be passed by means of postal ballot: 1) Ordinary resolution under section 293(1)(a) of the Companies Act,1956 to enable it to sell the Company's Tractors Division at Mandideep, Gears division at Parwanoo and Engine Division at Alwar ("Tractors and allied divisions") on a "slump sale" (as defined under Section 2 {42 C} of the Income Tax Act,1961) and 'going-concern' basis to TAFE MOTORS AND TRACTORS LIMITED (TMTL). This is in line with the company's strategy of focusing on select businesses in which it could attain a strong market position.  In order to achieve a higher growth trajectory in the Commercial Vehicles (CV) business, the company proposes to divest its Tractors and allied divisions. 2) Special resolution under section 17 and 18 of the Companies Act, 1956 for insertion of new sub-clause 30 in the other objects (clause III.C) after the existing sub-clause 29 of the Memorandum of Association of the Company.  The company has appointed Mr. Vijay Gupta, Practising Chartered Accountant, M/s. VKGN & Associates, as Scrutinizer for conducting the Postal Ballot process. The duly completed Postal Ballot Form should reach the scrutinizer on or before June 27, 2005. The results of the Postal Ballot will be announced by the Chairman of the Company on June 28, 2005.  A copy of the postal ballot notice shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

Eicher Motors Ltd has informed the Exchange that further to the resolution of the Board of Directors dated May 25, 2005, the Company has on May 27, 2005, entered into definitive agreements with TMTL in connection with the slump sale, on a 'going concern' basis, of the tractors, engines and gears divisions of the Company at Mandideep, Alwar and Parwanoo, respectively.

Eicher Motors Ltd has informed the Exchange that the BODs of the company has, at its meeting held on May 25, 2005:  1) Subject to approval of the shareholders of the Company, approved the slump sale (as defined in section 2(42C) of the Income Tax Act, 1961), on a 'going concern' basis, of the tractors, engines and gears divisions of the Company at Mandideep, Alwar and Parwanoo, respectively, to TAFE Motors and Tractors Limited, a wholly owned subsidiary of Tractors and Farm Equipment Limited, for a total consideration of Rs.310 crores (the "Transaction)  (a) Approved the agreed drafts of the agreements for the transaction and authorized certain officers of the company to execute necessary documents in this regard;  (b) Resolved to seek approval of the shareholders of the company pursuant to section 293(1)(a) of the Companies Act, 1956, as amended, by way of a postal ballot, for the proposed Transaction; 2) The Board also approved the investment upto USD 2.5 million, subject to compliance with applicable laws, for acquisition of a US based company engaged in computer aided engineering and design services. The Board further authorized certain officers of the company to execute necessary agreements in this regard. Pursuant to the proposed acquisition, the said company would become a wholly owned subsidiary of the company.

Eicher Motors Ltd has informed the Exchange that the auditor's have conducted the limited review for the un-audited financial results for the quarter ended December 31, 2004 and the details of the same are available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/CorporateAnnouncements).

Eicher Motors Ltd has informed the Exchange that the BODs of the company, met on February 25,2005 and they have, upon receipt of a proposal from Tractors and Farm Equipment Limited(TAFE), granted in-principle approval for exploring opportunities for sale of company's Tractors and Engine Businesses consisting of its units at Mandideep, Parwanoo and Alwar on a slump sale basis to TAFE. The BODs of the company has authorised certain persons to enter into further discussions and negotiations in relation to this proposed sale. The progress of the transaction would be subject to due diligence of the businesses, and approval by the BODs and shareholders of both companies.

Eicher Motors Ltd has informed the Exchange that the auditor's have conducted the limited review of the unaudited financial results for the quarter and half year ended September 30, 2004 and found the same to be in order subject to certain observations. The auditor's observations are: Pursuant to Notification No. CE(NT) - 11/95 dated March 16, 1995 issued by the Central Government, unutilized MODVAT balance amounting to Rs.821 lacs standing to the credit of the Company as on March 16, 1995 was to lapse. On a writ petition filed by the Company, the Hon'ble Supreme Court struck down the aforesaid notification. Subsequently, section 37 of the Central Excise Act, 1944 was amended by the Finance Act, 1999 with retrospective effect from March 16, 1995 to validate the said notification. The Company has challenged the aforesaid amendment before the Delhi High Court. Pending disposal of the case, no provision is considered necessary in respect of the MODVAT balance of Rs.821 lacs lying unutilized as on March 16, 1995.

desc: Reg.7(1) of SEBI (Substantial Acq of shares &Takeovers),1997
attchmntText: Arisaig Partners (Asia) Pte Ltd C/o Arisaig India Fund Limited has informed the Exchange that they have acquired 6,698 shares amounting to 0.02% of the total paid up capital of Eicher Motors Limited. The shareholding of Arisaig Partners (Asia) Pte Ltd C/o Arisaig India Fund Limited after acquisition is 1,404,830 shares amounting to 5.00% of the total paid up capital Eicher Motors Limited. The mode of acquisition is through open market and the date of acquisition is November 01, 2004.
